meta.content: The Pelham School District, in collaboration with the community we serve, is committed to providing a high-quality, contemporary education in a safe and inclusive environment. Our goal is to educate, prepare, and inspire all students to achieve their full potential as life-long learners, critical thinkers, and contributing citizens to our global society.

div.p: Happy St. Patrick’s Day! I want to thank all the staff who helped with the distribution of student materials today. All distributions went very smoothly. The energy in each building was very positive. If for some reason you were not able to pick up your child’s materials for remote learning please contact the front office of your child’s school and they will make arrangements and a time for you to pick up those materials tomorrow.

In Pelham, the safety of our students and staff is our top priority. Refer to the COVID-19 website for regular updates and resources in an effort to help families reduce the risk in their homes and community. The link is below or you can go to the SAU 28 website to access the COVID-19 resource page.

We are diligently working on assessing the need of our students in regards to food. Please go to our COVID-19 page and click on the survey link. This is a one question survey asking if you would be interested or need a grab and go type food service in the coming weeks. As you can imagine we wish to support our families if there is a need. Please check out our new site and click on the survey. Thank you in advance for helping us with this service.

As we move to remote learning there is a new reliance on technology to be working both for our students and staff. Please continue to report any technology difficulties using the link below. When you create a new support ticket you will be contacted by an IT technician who will be able to assist you.

div.p: We continue to make progress everyday. Thank you all for your support and efforts. I am so proud of our community and the level of support we continue to show one another. Stay healthy.

Sincerely,
Bill Furbush
Superintendent of Schools
